I am post menopause - no tumor size on report - I'm really scared - from what I've been reading her2 3+ is not good - why didn't dr. say anything about herceptin (is that a form of chemo?) Posts.Title: Is her2 +++ really bad? ftreloar nash

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2008 03:02PM ftreloar wrote: Thanks Beesie, I hope that is the case about the DCIS, but she still plans on doing the sentinel node biopsy - she said if there wasn't invasive micros - then it would be a straight lumpectomy.  Well at least maybe if it is the dcis being 3+, I won't have to have chemo.
Posts.Title: Is her2 +++ really bad? ftreloar nash

Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2008 04:39PM ftreloar wrote: Thank you everyone - this info has helped alot!  I feel much better & will try & stay calm until my surgery sch'd for 5/6 or 5/9.  Not too far away!  Beesie,  I looked at my current path report & it says her2neu test:  A storng complete membrane staining is observed in more than 30% of the tumor cells - interpreted as strongly positive (3+) so I don't know if its in the invasive part or in the duct.  But in the final diagnosis it says:  microscopic foci of infiltrating ductal carcinoma, nuclear grade 3 associated with ductal carcinoma in-situ. I did have an MRI & it didn't show any other cancer so I hope that's good.  P.s. how do you get that little line in your msg. that has your dx date,etc.?
Posts.Title: Is her2 +++ really bad? ftreloar nash

Posts.Content: ftreloar wrote: I met with the radiology oncologist to discuss my radiation options - I've decided, if lymph nodes negative, to go with the partial breast irradiation.  What I'm not sure about is the baloon(don't know if I'm allowed to mention the name of it here), which seems too complicated & I don't like the fact of having a catheter in my breast, plus chance of infection.  I like the 3-D Conformal/External Beam idea of just having radiation, no catheter.  But there doesn't seem like alot of women doing this one.  Why not?  It seems so much easier.  Just looking for comments or anyone who has had the 3-D.
